Build the Layout of a Form

Use OmniScript Designer lay out your form by dragging elements into position. Preview elements in steps, customize properties, and access contextual guidance to discover and learn about functionality while creating your script.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience in Enterprise, Professional, and Unlimited Editions with Financial Services Cloud
Available in: Lightning Experience in Enterprise and Unlimited Editions with Health Cloud
Available in: Lightning Experience in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions with Education Cloud
Available in: Lightning Experience in Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer Editions with Nonprofit Cloud
Available in: Lightning Experience in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions with Public Sector Solutions


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To build the layout of a form:	

Financial Services Cloud Extension AND OmniStudio Admin AND OmniStudio Runtime permission sets

For Public Sector Solutions, only OmniStudio Admin is required

From the App Launcher, search for OmniScripts, and then select OmniScripts.
Change the list view to All OmniScripts.
Select an existing OmniScript.
This operation opens the selected OmniScript in the OmniScript Designer on a new tab. In the Header, you can view high-level metadata about the OmniScript such as Type, SubType, Version, Language, and Activation status.
To add more questions to the form, at the upper-right corner of the form, click Edit Form.
NOTE While building the layout of the form, if some questions in the OmniScript are no longer in the active version, click Edit Form at the upper-right corner and then click OK. This operation refreshes the OmniScript with the latest active question versions.
From the Navigation panel, access and navigate between active and inactive actions, steps, and step elements.
To preview and configure elements, on the canvas, expand the steps.
To build your scripts, drag the action, display, function, group, and input elements, and entire OmniScripts from the Build panel onto the canvas.
Enhance the form by dragging the required elements from the palette onto the form.
In the Properties panel, either configure the properties for action, display, function, group, input, and embeddable OmniScript elements in the UI or edit the properties as JSON values.
In the Setup panel, configure optional script-wide settings.
NOTE For Discovery Framework OmniScripts, usageType is a reserved keyword. You cannot use usageType as a key value in OmniScript Data JSON. For example, you can’ use usageType in Assessment Question names, Data Raptor outputs, and so on.
Use Data from Previously Submitted Responses
Save your respondents the time and effort of entering responses to the same questions on different assessment forms. By adding the prefill integration procedure to an OmniScript, the form can access data from previously submitted assessments. Customize the prefill integration procedure to suit your needs.
Designate Questions to Prefill with Previously Submitted Responses
Save your respondents the time and effort of entering responses to specific questions more than one time. Collect new responses for certain questions on assessment forms, and prefill other questions with data retrieved from previous assessment responses. To access data from previously submitted responses, activate the prefill assessment question decision table and the prefill with decision table integration procedure. Then set up OmniScripts to determine whether to prefill questions.
Add a QR Code to an Assessment Form
Include a QR code on a form to let respondents open the URL or application from their mobile device. For example, respondents can scan the QR code to open a third-party application and upload documents for identity verification and screening.
Capture a Respondent’s Signature on the Form
Respondents can use a digital signature to authenticate their responses on the form when you add the Discovery Framework Signature element to a form. They can either type or draw their name or initials, and use the signature in multiple places on the form before submitting it. The Assessment Signature object stores the signature details, and the Digital Signature object stores the signature.
Dynamically Identify the Documents to Upload for an Assessment
Use the Document Matrix element in Discovery Framework–based OmniScripts to streamline the assessment process and ensure that respondents upload the correct documents.
Save Assessments as Drafts in Health Cloud
Internal Health Cloud users can save drafts of the assessments that they’re not ready to submit. They can easily find the draft assessments that are in progress and complete them at their convenience later. The flexibility to save drafts prevents loss of work when internal users pause an assessment for any reason.
